title: Botswana's economy to grow 4.3% in 2019 - deputy finance sec
text:
A car drives past a construction site of the Central Business District (CBD) in the capital Gaborone, Botswana, September 21, 2018. REUTERS/Siphiwe Sibeko

GABORONE (Reuters) - Botswana’s economy is expected to grow 4.3% in 2019 and 4.6% in 2020, benefiting from a developing services sector, Deputy Secretary in the ministry of finance, Kelapile Ndobano, said on Tuesday.

The southern African nation’s 2019/20 fiscal deficit is seen at 3.8% of gross domestic product, Ndobano told a budget conference.
description: Botswana's economy is expected to grow 4.3% in 2019 and 4.6% in 2020, benefiting from a developing services sector, Deputy Secretary in the ministry of finance, Kelapile Ndobano, said on Tuesday.
